direct_answer.text:
First, let's simplify the denominator:
\begin{align*}
2^2 \cdot 5^7 &= 4 \cdot 78125 \\
&= 312500.
\end{align*}
Since both 2 and 5 are prime factors, any power of them would also produce powers of 10 when multiplied together. In other words, since every second digit represents 2 times some value and every fifth digit represents 5 times some value, it follows that terms appearing beyond multiple occurrences of either base cancel each other out completely during multiplication operations within those periods - meaning no trailing zeros occur unless one exists already initially due present conditions; therefore our initial numeral becomes simply divided into groups consisting solely tens as well having nothing further requiring division but instead just being added onto said groupings through simple subtraction operation performed sequentially rather than individually based off previous results themselves!

subanswer.text: Simplifying the denominator results in $2^2 \cdot 5^7 = (2*5)^7= 10^7$. So now our expression becomes \[\frac{21}{10^7}\]. The answer is $\frac{21}{10^7}$.
